other_tests.findings: Normal marrow cellularity with trilineage maturing hematopoiesis in normal proportions. Some megakaryocytes appeared small, with hypolobated nuclei.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The repeat bone marrow aspirate obtained 5 years later revealed recurrent morphologic dysplasia, abnormal hypogranulated myeloid cells, dyserythropoiesis, and an increase in myeloblasts to 11%.

other_tests.findings: Normal sinus rhythm with evidence of left atrial enlargement and right bundle-branch block.
Stenosis of the left main and left anterior descending coronary arteries and moderate aortic stenosis.
Suggested a high probability of pulmonary emboli.
Level of anticardiolipin IgM antibodies was 20.4 (reference range, 0 to 15 IgM phospholipid units); other tests of hypercoagulability were negative.
